intro: Alpinia sasakii, commonly known as the Sasak ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, leafy stems and clusters of fragrant, pale-yellow to white flowers. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to other ginger species. Alpinia sasakii thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
